intro: Landolphia bruneelii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red berries that contain multiple seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and agricultural purposes.
